metadata.title: Ecosystem energy stays on-topic
metadata.description: Baseline on-track conversation for energy flow lesson.
metadata.goal: Students describe how energy transfers among producers, consumers, and decomposers.
metadata.subject: science
metadata.driftNotes: Alignment remains above Tier1 gating threshold.

transcript.text: Let's recap how energy moves through an ecosystem.
Energy enters when producers capture sunlight.
The producers store that energy in sugars that consumers can eat.
Primary consumers transfer the energy when they eat the plants.
Secondary consumers pass along less energy because some is lost as heat.
Decomposers recycle what is left back into the soil.
Exactly, the nutrients return so producers can grow again.
So energy flows in one direction while matter cycles.
That helps ecosystems stay balanced when each role is filled.
Great synthesis. Capture that in your notes.
